result.execSummary:
The defendant Stacey Boyd was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stacey Boyd

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:

The Court ordered defendant to serve 75 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 (zero) days time served, STRAIGHT 
TIME.  

AS TO COUNT 2:

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

The Court ordered defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 11 (eleven) days time served, STRAIGHT TIME.  

AS TO BOTH COUNTS"

Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges by June 9, 2016, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.

Court ordered all non-mandatory costs waived due to defendant's financial instability.


Filed;
-Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
-Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Stacey Boyd in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Stacey Boyd in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2:

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

AS TO COUNT 3:

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court, defendant Stacey Boyd not in court, in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for plea/sentencing hearing. No DA file in court.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
Court ordered defendant to be monitored by Drug Testing
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Family Dollar
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Stacey Boyd in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Stacey Boyd in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37 due to lower pending cases.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
